message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.MM, cs.SY, cs.CR 

Reasoning: 

1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - This paper proposes a concept of safe carrier-sensing range in CSMA networks, which is a fundamental concept in networking. The paper investigates the effectiveness of carrier sensing under the cumulative interference model, which is a key aspect of networking. 

2. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper discusses the safe carrier-sensing range concept in the context of the cumulative interference model, which involves analyzing the information content of the signals transmitted by different nodes. 

3. cs.MM (Multimedia) - The paper discusses the Incremental-Power Carrier-Sensing (IPCS) mechanism, which is a carrier-sensing mechanism that can separate the detected power of every concurrent transmitter. This mechanism is relevant to multimedia applications that require efficient and reliable transmission of data. 

4. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper proposes a concept of safe carrier-sensing range that can guarantee interference safe transmissions in CSMA networks. This concept is relevant to systems and control, as it involves ensuring the stability and reliability of the network. 

5. cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) - The paper discusses the concept of safe carrier-sensing range, which is relevant to ensuring the security of the network. The paper also proposes the IPCS mechanism, which can provide more accurate distance information and improve the security of the network.
